sense.name: grow worse or weaker
sense.examples: His health had severely declined. Data indicate that overall river conditions declined from 1995 to 1996.

sense.name: refuse to accept or do
sense.examples: The authorities declined to comment on the report. I declined their offer of housing. The Freeholders declined to extend benefits. He declined to join the group on a hike.

sense.name: grow smaller or diminish
sense.examples: The stocks declined in value. Interest in the project declined. Compared to 1995, death among men declined by 22%.

sense.name: slope downwards
sense.examples: The bridge declined to meet the street level. The roof declines here.

sense.name: inflect for number, gender, case
sense.examples: Decline the nouns and conjugate the verbs that follow. These adjectives decline just like any other strong adjectives.
